newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: PAKISTAN COTTON RATES STEADY ON SLOW SUPPLY.
newsitem.headline: PAKISTAN COTTON RATES STEADY ON SLOW SUPPLY.

text.p: Pakistani cotton rates were steady on Monday as rains in Sindh province slowed arrivals and dealers said rates would stay stable in the next few days.
"The recent rains have delayed picking, and arrival of fresh supplies slowed down," dealer Nasim Usman said.
Dealers said roads leading to cotton-growing areas were in poor shape and rain often disrupted cotton transport.
Usman said mills were piling up stocks and the rates would hover at current levels until new cotton arrivals from Punjab province pick up in September.
In the kerb, new-crop NIAB-78 variety was traded at around 2,300 rupees ($56.62) per maund (37.32 k.g).
